text: Can I create object names from a text file in Python 2.7?
I'm working on a game project.
I want to assign the name of the variables, dynamically, from a text file.
If I have a text file with:
I want the program to create the Star(Object) with variable names from the text file.
I want the process automated, because I'm looking to create hundreds of stars.
I could write the code out by hand:

code:
Sol = Star(Sol)
Centauri = Star(Centauri)
Vega = Star(Vega)

text: But isn't there a way to automate this?
Essentially, what I eventually want is a tuple with the list of stars, as their own objects.
Then, when I am doing game maintenance, I can just iterate over all the objects in the tuple.
